title: Merna Presents Research at Assumption
maintext:
WORCESTER -- Megan Merna of Chelmsford is one of 78 students selected to present an original academic research project at Assumption College’s recent 24th annual Undergraduate Symposium.
The Undergraduate Symposium showcases the academic research and scholarly achievements of Assumption students working in collaboration with faculty mentors.
Merna, a freshman, presented “Serving the Worcester Community: An Oral History about Public Service.” This research examined how Jill Dagilis, executive director of the Worcester Community Action Council since 2006 and a woman working in a male-dominated field, overcame obstacles to get where she is today.
